item.description: Military turmoil in China raises Taiwan invasion concerns as Xi Jinping removes senior officers. Analysts warn of growing instability despite control.

item.title: Chinese hackers reportedly breached phones at 'heart of Downing Street' in global spy campaign
item.description: Chinese state-linked hackers reportedly breached phones "at the heart of Downing Street," and allegedly accessed the phone data of millions.

item.title: Death toll from Indonesia landslide rises to 17 as dozens remain missing
item.description: Among the 42 people missing after landslide in West Java, 19 were members of Indonesia’s elite marine force.

item.title: EU probes Musk’s Grok AI feature over deepfakes of women, minors
item.description: European Commission says its investigation will examine if the AI tool has met its legal obligations.

item.title: Ex-FIFA president Sepp Blatter warns soccer fans against traveling to US for 2026 World Cup under Trump
item.description: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter warned international soccer fans to avoid traveling to the U.S. for the 2026 World Cup, citing President Donald Trump's policies.

item.title: Feds charge 87 individuals in massive ATM 'jackpotting' operation linked to Tren de Aragua gang
item.description: Massive ATM theft ring exposed 87 members of Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua accused of stealing millions through "jackpotting" scheme to fund terrorism.

item.title: Fetterman opposes shutdown efforts as Democratic colleagues move to block ICE funding bill
item.description: Pennsylvania senator cites military pay concerns after fatal shooting of Alex Pretti by federal agent mobilized Senate Democrats to oppose DHS funding bill.

item.title: Former DHS secretary says Trump's choice to send 'border czar' Tom Homan to Minnesota is 'stroke of genius'
item.description: Former DHS Secretary Chad Wolf calls President Donald Trump's decision to send "border czar" Tom Homan to Minnesota a "stroke of genius" for deportations.

item.title: Former Trail Blazers center Chris Dudley makes second run for governor of Oregon
item.description: Former NBA player Chris Dudley announced his governor run in Oregon for 2026, joining a crowded Republican field to challenge Gov. Tina Kotek.

item.title: GOP senator demands DHS immigration chiefs testify after fatal shootings in Minnesota
item.description: Sen. Rand Paul's, R-Ky., request comes on the heels of the latest fatal shooting involving a border patrol agent, though his inquiry is more focused on the billions flowing to DHS.

item.title: Gustavo Petro: Colombia’s former rebel fighter turned president
item.description: From urban rebel to senator facing death threats, what drives Petro, 65, the country’s first progressive president?

item.title: ICC judges find former Philippine President Duterte fit to stand trial
item.description: Judges cite report by medical experts saying the 80-year-old is able 'effectively to exercise his procedural rights'.

item.title: ICE agents will conduct enforcement operations at Super Bowl LX, official says
item.description: ICE agents will conduct enforcement operations at Super Bowl LX as President Donald Trump boycotts the game, criticizing Grammy-winner Bad Bunny's halftime show selection.

item.title: Iran regime reportedly issued nationwide shoot-to-kill orders as protest death toll surges
item.description: Iran protest death toll estimates range from several thousand to over 35,000 as brutal crackdown intensifies. Medical data reveals shocking scale of violence.

item.title: Iranian security forces gun down amateur boxer as father searches morgues for missing son: source
item.description: Iranian security forces allegedly killed amateur boxer Sepehr Ebrahimi during ongoing protests near Tehran. The death adds to Iran's rising protest toll of at least 6,126 people killed.

item.title: Is the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown working?
item.description: There has been a second fatal shooting in the US state of Minnesota this month.

item.title: Israel confirms recovery of last hostage's remains from Gaza
item.description: The remains of Ran Gvili, the final Israeli hostage held by Hamas, have been recovered from Gaza. The police officer died defending Israel on Oct. 7.

item.title: Israeli and Palestinian captives and prisoners: A timeline of key events
item.description: Israelis held captive in Gaza and Palestinians swept into Israel detention centres have been focus of ceasefire talks.

item.title: Lula, Trump discuss ‘Board of Peace’, agree to meet in Washington: Brazil
item.description: Lula criticises US actions in Venezuela, calling the capture of Maduro an unacceptable line against regional stability.

item.title: Mamdani's early moves as mayor clash with affordability pledge: 'Ripple effects are significant'
item.description: Mamdani campaigned on making New York more affordable, but his early delivery-app crackdown has business experts warning new mandates will push costs onto customers.

item.title: Massive search underway for dozens missing in deadly Indonesia landslide
item.description: At least 80 people, including 19 members of an elite marine force, are missing in a landslide in Indonesia.

item.title: Melissa Gilbert speaks out amid husband Timothy Busfield's child sex abuse charges
item.description: Melissa Gilbert speaks out on husband Timothy Busfield's child sex abuse charges, and thanks fans for their support.

item.title: Minnesota, ICE and the makings of a US civil war
item.description: A 2024 simulation found US civil war could be triggered by clashes between state and federal law enforcement.

item.title: Much of US digging out from snow, sleet, ice from massive winter storm
item.description: A huge winter storm has brought frigid temperatures, snow, and sleet to more than a dozen US states.

item.title: Netanyahu says next phase of ceasefire is ‘demilitarising’ Gaza
item.description: Benjamin Netanyahu said the next phase of the ceasefire will be “disarming Hamas and demilitarising the Gaza Strip.”

item.title: Olympic medalist spurns Canada in hopes of swimming for Team USA: 'Always felt like an American'
item.description: Ilya Kharun, a Canadian butterfly swimmer who won two bronze medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will switch his team from the Great White North to the U.S.

item.title: Police hunt for Mick Jagger's granddaughter's longtime partner after he disappears
item.description: Mick Jagger's granddaughter's partner Alexander Key, 37, missing after leaving Devon pub Friday. Police search ongoing for blonde-haired man last seen.

item.title: Remains of last Israeli captive Ran Gvili recovered from Gaza, says Israel
item.description: Retrieval of Gvili's body could pave the way for next phase of the ceasefire, including reopening the Rafah crossing.

item.title: Russia reportedly slams Trump’s Golden Dome as 'provocative' as trillion-dollar shield takes shape
item.description: Russia reportedly called the U.S. Golden Dome missile defense project "provocative" as an expert says Russia's reaction shows the system's power as a bargaining chip.

item.title: Sewage spill sends E coli surging in the Potomac River near DC
item.description: Potomac River sewage spill creates E. coli contamination 12,000 times above safe limits near Washington, D.C., affecting local waterways and public health.

item.title: Shirtless Florida man who jumped through Taco Bell window, robbed it with 'large rock' sentenced to 4 years
item.description: A Florida man was sentenced to four years in prison after his shirtless Taco Bell robbery using a "large rock" to threaten workers and customers.

item.title: Skier suffers brutal mauling after stepping within 10 feet of snow leopard for photo, video shows
item.description: Female skier survives snow leopard mauling in China's Fuyun County after authorities warned tourists about predator sightings near hotel, according to reports.

item.title: Social media post about Tennessee mayor's children sparks feud with local Democrats
item.description: Tennessee Republican mayor clashes with Democrats over Planned Parenthood training post, creating political firestorm in Hamilton County community.

item.title: The ‘discombobulator’: Did US use ‘secret weapon’ in Maduro abduction?
item.description: US President Donald Trump refers to a ‘sonic weapon’ he describes as a ‘discombobulator’, but what is he talking about?

item.title: Trump admin wins court victory freeing ICE agents from Minnesota protest restrictions
item.description: Federal appeals court blocks restrictions on ICE tactics against Minnesota protesters, overturning lower court ruling in ongoing civil rights case.

item.title: Trump has 'very good' call with Minneapolis Mayor Frey, announces border czar Homan meeting
item.description: President Trump announced a "very good" call with Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey as riots continue amid federal immigration enforcement. Tom Homan will meet with the mayor tomorrow.

item.title: Trump says Iran called 'numerous' times to make deal as carrier enters Middle East waters
item.description: President Donald Trump indicated Iran is seeking negotiations as the USS Abraham Lincoln carrier enters the region and protests continue inside Iran.

item.title: Trump says US Justice Department ‘looking at’ Ilhan Omar’s wealth
item.description: Somali American congresswoman accuses US president of deflecting from his own 'failures' with 'conspiracy theories'.

item.title: Trump’s second term: ‘Reality has overtaken satire’
item.description: Marc Lamont Hill sits down with The Nation’s Katrina vanden Heuvel to unpack the first year of Trump’s second term.

item.title: Unsealed records in Idaho student murders detail victims' injuries, final movements
item.description: A forensic account of the 2022 University of Idaho slayings revealed specific injury counts and new analysis regarding the students' final movements.

item.title: USS Abraham Lincoln Aircraft Carrier Strike Group makes move amid threat from Iran
item.description: USS Abraham Lincoln entered CENTCOM waters Monday amid escalating threats from Iran and the potential for a "credible" drone attack on the U.S.

item.title: Venezuelan opposition leader says democratic transition would be 'fall of the Berlin Wall' for Americas
item.description: Opposition leader María Corina Machado said she intends to return to Venezuela soon to help drive a democratic transition.

item.title: White House attacks ‘sensationalist’ media over Alex Pretti coverage
item.description: The White House attacked the "liberal biased media" in response to a leading question about the killing of Alex Pretti.

item.title: Zelenskyy says US security guarantees document is '100% ready' for signing
item.description: Ukraine's Zelenskyy says U.S. security guarantees document is "100% ready" for signing as trilateral peace talks with Russia expected to continue in Abu Dhabi.

item.title: After Trump strikes Islamist terrorists, US general travels to Nigeria with militants 'on the run'
item.description: Lt. Gen. John Brennan details U.S. military support helping Nigerian forces combat Islamic State and Boko Haram terrorists following strikes that disrupted terror networks.

item.title: China's top general ousted, placed under investigation in latest military purge
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping removed China's top general Zhang Youxia amid an investigation for violating party discipline in latest military purge.

item.title: Emory fires Iranian official's daughter after campus protests over controversial hiring decision
item.description: Fatemeh Ardeshir-Larijani, daughter of sanctioned Iranian official Ali Larijani, lost her position at Emory University as activists called for review of her immigration status.

item.title: How the Oct 7 Hamas terror attacks exposed long-running concerns about UNRWA, new film charges
item.description: Tracing UNRWA from 1949 to today, the film examines refugee policy, weak oversight and alleged links to Hamas control in Gaza, raising questions about the agency’s role and accountability.

item.title: Iranian drone swarms pose 'credible threat' to USS Abraham Lincoln carrier group, defense expert says
item.description: USS Abraham Lincoln strike group approaches Middle East amid warnings that Iranian drone capabilities worth "tens of millions of dollars" threaten U.S. naval vessels.

item.title: Israel announces limited reopening of Rafah Crossing under Trump’s 20-point plan
item.description: Netanyahu agrees to reopen Gaza's Rafah crossing under President Trump's 20-point peace plan, pending the recovery of the final Israeli hostage.

item.title: Italy’s Meloni rebukes Trump remarks on NATO’s role in Afghanistan
item.description: Italian PM Giorgia Meloni calls Trump's NATO comments about Afghanistan "unacceptable," defending Italy's sacrifice of 53 soldiers killed in the conflict.

item.title: Macron says children's brains are 'not for sale,' urges fast-track to ban social media for kids under 15
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron pushes lawmakers to ban social media for kids under 15, saying children's emotions won't be manipulated by "American Platforms" or "Chinese algorithms."

item.title: Syrian militiaman shows off what he claims to be severed Kurdish fighter's braid as Damascus asserts control
item.description: A video of a Syrian fighter holding a braid he claims was taken from a Kurdish woman in Raqqa sparked outrage and protests as Damascus expands control amid a fragile ceasefire.

item.title: Zelenskyy touts ‘constructive’ trilateral talks between the US, Russia and Ukraine in Abu Dhabi
item.description: Ukraine's Zelenskyy calls recent US-Russia-Ukraine talks in Abu Dhabi "constructive," marking potential breakthrough in diplomatic efforts to end the war.

item.title: Another Christian community at risk in Africa as extremists and war take their toll
item.description: Sudan's civil war has reportedly killed 150,000 people and displaced 13 million as Christians face daily terror. Government forces allegedly killed 11 Christians on Christmas Day.

item.title: Boy, 12, dies after shark attack while swimming at popular cliff-jumping spot: 'We are heartbroken'
item.description: Nico Antic, 12, died from injuries after a shark attack at Sydney Harbour's Jump Rock. Friends heroically pulled him to safety after the attack.

item.title: Iran Revolutionary Guard commander says regime has 'finger on the trigger' as US warships head to Middle East
item.description: Iran's Revolutionary Guard chief warns the U.S. it has a "finger on the trigger" as American warships head to the Middle East amid anti-regime protests.

item.title: Lindsey Graham says there's 'strong consensus' to protect Kurds as Syrian forces advance on territory
item.description: Sen. Lindsey Graham and former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo warn of dire threats to Syrian Kurds as Syrian forces attack Kurdish-controlled territory in northern Syria.
